data.text:
What were some of his accomplishments?

​AWARDS:

1962 - Nobel Prize in Literature

1940 - Pulitzer Prize for Fiction - The Grapes of Wrath

1940 - National Book Award for Fiction - The Grapes of Wrath

1964 - Presidential Medal of Freedom

​ACHIEVEMENTS:

In 1940, this exceptional writer was honored with the 'National Book Award', and the 'Pulitzer Prize', for the novel, 'The Grapes of Wrath', which is the third novel from the 'Dustbowl' Trilogy.

For his novel, 'The Moon is Down', published in 1945, this great writer was felicitated with the 'Haakon VII Cross of Freedom' for writing about the Norwegian resistance movement.

Referred to as "a giant of American letters", in 1962, he was awarded the 'Nobel Prize in Literature'.

In September 1964, John received the most prestigious civilian award, Presidential Medal of Freedom, from the then Head of State, Lyndon B. Johnson.

In 2007, he was included posthumously in the California Hall of Fame for his contribution to the field of Literature.
